task_summary: Approach the cabinet, grasp the right hinged door handle, open the door, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: The robot operates at a countertop-facing cabinet. The goal is to open a small right-side hinged door using its handle. The plan first perceives the handle, approaches the cabinet, prepares the gripper, computes a pull-style grasp, verifies the pose, aligns, grasps, actuates an open motion for the hinged door, then releases and retreats to a safe pose. Timeouts and small tolerances are used to keep motions reliable in a confined workspace near the table edge and other objects.
preconditions: Robot in front of cabinet within reachable workspace
Hinged door handle is visible to sensors
stepwise_plan: Detect the cabinet door handle and move to the cabinet face.
Open gripper and compute a pull grasp on the handle; verify pose availability.
Align to the handle and execute a grasp.
Command an open operation on the hinged door.
Release the handle and retreat to clear the door swing.
success_criteria: Door angle increases visibly from closed to open state
No collisions with cabinet or table
Robot ends in a safe, stable pose
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, re-detect and re-approach the cabinet.
If grasp is unstable, reopen gripper, realign, and recompute grasp pose.
If door resists opening, retry open with a fresh alignment after a small retreat.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the door is confirmed open and the robot has released the handle and retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Perceive the door handle on the cabinet.
Move the end-effector to the cabinet face region.
Prepare the gripper for grasping the handle.
Compute a pull-style grasp on the handle and store it.
Verify that the grasp pose key is available.
Precisely align to the handle before grasping.
Close the gripper to grasp the handle using the computed pose.
Back away to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Handle not detected due to glare or pose
Door binds or catches during opening
Premature release before door clears latch
recovery_strategy: Repeat detection and slight viewpoint change
Re-align with tighter tolerance and retry grasp
Perform small retreat then re-open container
After release, re-grasp if door did not open sufficiently
assumptions: Frames show a small right-side hinged door of a toy/cabinet being opened using its handle.
Instruction 'open door' is mapped to a hinged cabinet door; direction of opening assumed to be pull then swing.

expected_success_criteria: Door opened beyond initial closed state
Robot releases handle and retreats safely
